name: Sumac-Lemon Roasted Salmon with Broccoli and Warm Tahini Drizzle
description: Oven-roasted salmon seasoned with sumac and lemon, served with garlicky roasted broccoli and a quick warm tahini drizzle. Mild, keto-friendly, and weeknight simple.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a large sheet pan.
Halve lemon; juice one half for the sauce and cut the other half into wedges.
Pat salmon dry with paper towels.
Measure out tahini, olive oil, sumac, salt, and black pepper.
cook_steps: Toss broccoli with 1.5 tbsp olive oil, half the minced garlic, a big pinch of salt, and black pepper on the sheet pan. Spread in a single layer and roast for 10 minutes.
Remove pan, push broccoli to the sides, and place salmon in the center. Drizzle salmon with 1 tbsp olive oil, sprinkle sumac, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Add lemon wedges to the pan.
Return pan to the oven and roast until salmon flakes and broccoli is tender-crisp, 8–10 minutes.
While salmon roasts, place a small pan over low heat. Whisk tahini with remaining 0.5 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and the lemon juice until smooth and slightly warm (30–60 seconds). Do not boil.
Plate salmon with broccoli. Squeeze roasted lemon over the salmon and drizzle with warm tahini. Serve immediately.

Remove pan, push broccoli to the sides, and place salmon in the center. Drizzle salmon with 1 tbsp olive oil, sprinkle sumac, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Add lemon wedges to the pan.
Return pan to the oven and roast until salmon flakes and broccoli is tender-crisp, 8–10 minutes.

Plate salmon with broccoli. Squeeze roasted lemon over the salmon and drizzle with warm tahini. Serve immediately.
